intro: Microchlaena yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan microchlaena, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as mountain forests. Its botanical features include a short stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and small, rounded leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
